The US is definitely not the greatest nation on earth, we've had as much of a part in andvancing the world as we've had in hindering it.  The majority of Americans are ignorant fucks that react emotionally to issues that instead call for the use of cold logic.  We get overly sentimental about our little corner of the earth and since most only pay attention to what they're spoon fed through mainstream media, we run off spouting off at the mouth about being more than we really are.  Most of us don't really even care to see the bigger picture.  For that, I ask the world to forgive and have patience.  There are some of us, a growing number, who see the problems and want real change.  I honestly believe that it would take a radical education reform for that to happen.  the way that our children are educated is appalling.  It really is like a 13 year assembly line.  Our culture is still reeling from the 80/early 90s materialism.  Most just want to get back to that idea where we're measured by our wealth and possessions.  we desperately need to get away from that line of thinking, but it won't change overnite, if ever.  It's my honest opinion that we really do have some of the shittiest people on earth, but the world has some of its own who are truly worthy of the title as well.  But, like I said, there is a minority of us who see the other members of the world community solely as borthers and sisters who are just really far away.  I hope all of you are well.

Also, I've seen plenty of movies from other countries (Swedish is my favourite, Bergman is God).

As far as the Chinese military goes, they don't have shit, just a lot of people. To infer that our Marines are nothing but hot air and bluster shows an absolute lack of intelligence of your part.
